summary: The Pulitzer Prizes are important awards given each year by Columbia University in New York. They honor great work in journalism, arts, and letters (writing) in the United States. Started in 1917 by Joseph Pulitzer, a wealthy newspaper publisher, there are now 24 different awards. In 2024, winners received a certificate and $15,000, except for the Public Service category, which gets a gold medal. Each year, three finalists are chosen for each prize.
title: Pulitzer Prize
